question: Consider the decimal number 15.75. How can we convert this entire number (both the integer and fractional parts) to binary?

answers.a: Repeated multiplication to convert the fractional part (0.75).
answers.b: Repeated division to convert the integer part (15)
answers.c: Repeated division to convert the integer part (15), Repeated multiplication to convert the fractional part (0.75) and then combine both parts.

question: In  32 bit IEEE Format Floating Point the Sign bit equals

answers.a: 1 when the number is negative and is 0 when the number is positive.
answers.b: 0 when the number is negative and is 1 when the number is positive.
answers.c: 0 when the number is negative and is 0 when the number is positive.
